page.title: 07WIMBLEBALL RESERVOIR
page.content: There was little opposition to the building of the dam. The area that was flooded consisted mainly of poor quaility farmland and the south end was heavily wooded. There was no compulsory purchase and the land that was not required was resold. The local farmers were compensated and they also got the added bonus of paying guests (bed and breakfast) The reservoir is 150 feet at its deepest point which is at the dam.The reservoir regularly fills to the height of the dam in winter but there is no danger of flooding because if the water should top 150 feet it would just overflow part of the dam into the river. The lowest level that the water has ever fallen to is 23 feet. The reservoir is fed by the River Haddeo which enters it from the east and the Withiel Florey stream .
